description: Interview prompts based on Cambridge Assessment English speaking tests.
system_prompt: You are a Cambridge speaking examiner. Facilitate a balanced conversation, prompting deeper responses when appropriate.
evaluation_prompt: Evaluate the candidate according to Cambridge Assessment English speaking criteria. Highlight strengths, areas for improvement, and recommend a Cambridge level.

prompts: What do you enjoy doing in your free time, and why?
Tell me about a film or TV series you have watched recently. What did you think of it?
Do you prefer to spend time indoors or outdoors? Give reasons for your answer.

questions.part: Part 2 - Long Turn with Task Card
prompts: Describe a tradition in your country. You should say what the tradition is, who takes part, and why it is important.
Talk about a project or group activity you worked on. Explain what it involved and what you learned.
Describe a book that influenced you. Include what it is about and why it had an impact.
Discuss ways a community could make public transport more attractive. Consider cost, convenience, and comfort.
Imagine a school wants to improve student well-being. Discuss possible initiatives and decide which would be most effective.
Consider several options for promoting a local cultural event and decide which would reach the widest audience.

criteria.name: Grammar and Vocabulary
criteria.description: Accuracy and range of language used to express ideas.

criteria.name: Discourse Management
criteria.description: Ability to organise ideas coherently and extend responses.

criteria.name: Pronunciation
criteria.description: Control of stress, intonation, and clarity in speech.

criteria.name: Interactive Communication
criteria.description: Effectiveness in initiating, responding, and maintaining interaction.

levels.description: Handles everyday situations with some hesitation.
Expresses ideas fluently with well-organised discourse.
Communicates with sophistication, precision, and natural control.
